翹.definition: to stick up; to rise on one end; to tilt

翹二郎腿.definition: to stick one leg over the other (when sitting)

翹企.definition: to look forward eagerly; to long for

翹嘴鷸.definition: (bird species of China) Terek sandpiper (Xenus cinereus)

翹居群首.definition: head and shoulders above the crowd (idiom); preeminent; outstanding

翹曲.definition: to warp; to bend; fig. distorted opinion; prejudice

翹望.definition: to raise one's head and look into the distance; fig. to forward to; to long for

翹班.definition: to skip work; to sneak out of work early

翹硬.definition: hard; erect; to be in erection

翹翹板.definition: see-saw; also written 蹺蹺板|跷跷板[qiao1 qiao1 ban3]

翹舌音.definition: retroflex sound (e.g. in Mandarin zh, ch, sh, r)

翹課.definition: to skip school; to cut class

翹起.definition: to stick up; to point sth up

翹足.definition: lit. on tiptoes; to look forward eagerly; to long for

翹足引領.definition: waiting on tiptoes and craning one's neck (idiom); to look forward eagerly; to long for; also pr. [qiao4 zu2 yin3 ling3]

翹足而待.definition: to expect in a short time (idiom); also pr. [qiao4 zu2 er2 dai4]

翹辮子.definition: (coll.) to die; to kick the bucket

翹首.definition: to raise one's head and look

翹首以待.definition: to hold one's breath (in anticipation) (idiom); to anxiously await

翹鼻麻鴨.definition: (bird species of China) common shelduck (Tadorna tadorna)
